content: Criminal law: Deals with criminal wrongs such as theft, murder, sexual abuse, and threatening. Criminal law also handles trials for convicted offenders.
White collar crime: Non-violent crimes that use deception to conceal other criminal conduct, acquire money, property, or any other gain.
Civil law: Deals with disputes between organizations and individuals. Civil law covers areas such as defamation, custody of children, and right to education.
Economic offenses: Can be political, social, personal, and economical in nature. The socio-economic condition of the society decides the types and frequency of the offenses.
Statutory criminal offences: Examples include drunk driving and consumption of drugs.
Contract killings: Involve engaging a professional gang for a monetary consideration. The chance of detection in contract killings is quite low.
Intellectual property law: Intellectual Property (IP) Lawyers handle such cases.
Robbery and dacoity: Dacoity is an aggravated form of robbery.
